section_2.instruction: When analyzing market saturation or growth opportunities, calculate market penetration rates (e.g., product adoption, subscriber penetration) to assess competitive moat and future growth potential.

section_5.instruction: When assessing growth drivers, analyze year-over-year growth rates for distinct customer segments or product lines, alongside per-customer usage metrics, to identify primary growth engines and engagement levels.

When assessing competitive dynamics and strategic positioning, analyze the impact of significant industry-wide structural changes (e.g., regulatory shifts, technological paradigm shifts, infrastructure models) on the company and its market.

section_6.instruction: When analyzing financial performance, calculate Year-over-Year (YoY) percentage changes for key financial metrics (e.g., revenue, EBITDA, EBIT, Net Income) to reveal growth trajectories and operational efficiency trends.
When analyzing operational performance, calculate year-over-year (YoY) growth rates for key volume and pricing metrics (e.g., units sold, ARPU) to identify trends and underlying growth drivers.

section_7.instruction: When assessing revenue sustainability, distinguish between recurring and non-recurring revenue components to project future growth more accurately and assess revenue quality.

When assessing cash generation quality, calculate the Operating Free Cash Flow (OFCF) to EBITDA ratio to understand how effectively operating profits convert into available cash after capital expenditures.

section_11.instruction: When analyzing board structure, calculate the percentage of independent non-executive directors to total board members to assess governance strength and oversight.
When analyzing capital management, calculate the proportion of debt raised allocated to capital expenditure versus general working capital to reveal investment priorities and growth strategies.

section_13.instruction: When analyzing financial performance, calculate year-on-year percentage changes in specific revenue streams to quantify growth or contraction trends and their magnitude.

When analyzing company strategic objectives, compare stated quantitative targets (e.g., revenue growth, market share) with recent actual financial or operational performance to reveal the current trajectory's alignment with future goals.

section_1.instruction: When analyzing workforce trends, calculate the year-over-year percentage change in total employee headcount to identify shifts in workforce size and potential efficiency or growth strategies.

When evaluating capital structure and asset strategy, analyze the proportion of owned assets versus right-of-use (leased) assets to understand capital intensity, operational flexibility, and long-term financial commitments.

section_4.instruction: When analyzing supplier base and supply chain risk, calculate the proportion of total spend by supplier segment (e.g., industry, related party) to reveal concentration risk and dependency.

section_8.instruction: When analyzing segment revenue performance, decompose revenue into its underlying drivers (e.g., volume x price, subscribers x ARPU) to pinpoint specific growth or decline factors.
When analyzing performance trends, compare Year-over-Year (YoY) and Quarter-over-Quarter (QoQ) growth rates across segments or metrics to identify short-term volatility versus long-term trends.

section_10.instruction: When analyzing shareholder structure, calculate the aggregate ownership percentage of the top N shareholders (e.g., Top 5, Top 10) to assess ownership concentration and potential control dynamics.
When analyzing beneficial ownership, map ownership structures by tracing through layers of holding companies to identify ultimate controllers, related parties, and potential conflicts of interest.

section_12.instruction: When analyzing board governance, calculate the percentage of independent directors and track changes year-over-year to reveal commitment to oversight and potential shifts in control.

When analyzing executive incentives, break down total remuneration into fixed versus variable components (salary, bonus, long-term incentives) and assess vesting conditions to understand alignment with company performance and shareholder interests.

section_14.instruction: When assessing a company's financial capacity for strategic investments, calculate the Net Debt-to-EBITDA ratio to understand leverage and its ability to fund future capital expenditures.
